events.name: Google Cloud Study Jam
events.description:
• What we'll do
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin?

Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Together we'll work through three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs, then you will get free access to the next quest so you can finish this series of labs at home to get a Google-hosted badge for your online profile. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Google Compute Engine, which will earn you additional badges.

Join this meetup to get official Google training, a $70+ value, free of charge.

Bring a laptop with the latest versions of the popular Internet browsers installed. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

Everyone who attends the Study Jam gets a free 1-month pass to Qwiklabs. If Cloud Study Jam attendees earn the GCP Essentials badge within that first month, they will get another free 1-month pass to use any way they choose. Those who have earned the GCP Essentials badge within the first month will receive extra second campaign link with an additional 30-days pass benefit.

There will be food and drinks for the evening.

Location: Universistet i Agder (UiA) Grimstad, Main Building, Room A3020.

Agenda:

17:15 : Three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs:

* GSP001 - Creating a Virtual Machine

* GSP003 - Provision Services with Cloud Launcher

* GSP004 - Creating a Persistent Disk (Activity Tracking)

18:30 : Break. Food and drinks.

19:00 : Rent-a-VM to Process Earthquake Data

20:00 : End

• What to bring
laptop

events.name: Flutter Workshop: The future of native app development?
events.description:
Write code once, compile and run NATIVE code on both iOS and Android.
Is that possible?

Google I/O ’17 introduced us to Flutter — a new open source library for creating mobile applications. Flutter beta was released in February 2018, but it is already fully usable and with a lot of plugins (or libraries if you like).
https://hackernoon.com/flutter-5-reasons-why-you-may-love-it-55021fdbf1aa

In this workshop, Harald, will lead us through the creation of a basic Chat application.
NOTE: Please install Android Studio (ver 3.0 or newer) or Xcode (ver 9 or newer) before the Meetup, so that we can focus on the fun stuff.

Room C2040, UiA Grimstad

events.name: Møt JavaBin, NUUG, WebDev og GDG Sørlandet på CoWorx
events.description:
Scroll below for the English version.
Norsk:
Onsdag 9. mai møtes GDG Sørlandet i Kristiansand på CoWorx, og slår oss sammen for kvelden med JavaBin, Norwegian .NET User Group Kristiansand (NNUG) og WebDev Sørlandet (WebDev)!

Temaet for treffet er funksjonell programmering og serverless hosting. Bidragsytere fra de ulike gruppene vil demonstrere løsninger på samme problemstilling, løst i sine foretrukne programmeringsspråk, og vise hvordan løsningene kan kjøres i skyen med minst mulig oppsett:

- GDG demonstrer kode i Python og hosting i Google Cloud
- javaBin demonstrerer kode i Java / andre JVM-språk, samt hosting på Amazon Lambda
- NNUG demonstrerer kode i .NET og hosting i Azure Functions
- Kristiansand WebDev demonstrerer kode i JavaEcmaScript og hosting i “skyen”

En glimrende anledning til å bli kjent med de andre teknologileirene og til å bli inspirert!

Arrangementet er gratis for alle som er medlemmer i en av de nevnte Meetup-gruppene. Programmet varer til ca 20/21, men det er fullt mulig å være der lenger for å sosialisere. Det blir enkel matservering (pizza eller lignende). Det er ikke servering av drikke i lokalet (utover vann og kaffe), men det er lov å nyte medbragt ;-)

English:
Friday, 9th May is the next GDG Sørlandet meetup at CoWorx in Kristiansand co-hosted with JavaBin, Norwegian .NET User Group Kristiansand (NNUG) og WebDev Sørlandet (WebDev)!

The theme for this workshop is functional programming and serverless hosting across different programming languages and cloud services.

- GDG demonstrates Python code hosted on Google Cloud
- javaBin demonstrates Java code / other JVM-languages hosted on Amazon Lambda
- NNUG demonstrates code in .NET and hosting on Azure Functions
- Kristiansand WebDev demonstrates code in JavaEcmaScript and hosting in “cloud”.

Its a great opportunity to learn and mingle with other technology groups in the region.
There will also be some food. Though participation is free for the members of the groups, there are limited spots. So hurry up!

events.name: Build scalable web and mobile backend on Google App Engine: Python demo
events.description:
We start the season with a demo/workshop on How to deploy a Python/Django App on Google App Engine.
In this meetup we will start from scratch to create a simple Django project, deploy it to Google App Engine and go live!
I will share some tips on how to log and monitor your application.
If time permits, we will break the monolithic app into micro-services.

You DONT need to be an expert on Python/Django.
But to follow the workshop you do need to be familiar with installing packages.

I will be using a Ubuntu OS (16.04) for demo.
So Ubuntu (Linux) and Mac users will find it easier to follow.
Windows OS users need to get familiar with installing Python packages (preferably using pip in Python virtual environments), system paths, etc on Windows.

My system info:
Python[masked]
Django 1.8
appcfg.py tool
To download appcfg.py look for "Download and install the original App Engine SDK for Python" at the bottom of this link for Windows/Linux/Mac.
https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/standard/python/download#appengine_sdk

Room: C2 040, UiA Grimstad

events.name: Machine Learning Study Jam
events.description:
New to machine learning but don't know where to start? Join GDG Sørlandet & Digin for a Machine Learning Study Jam where we will run through the Machine Learning Crash Course (MLCC)!

This course is intended for those who wish to learn about ML from a practical, applied perspective that will enable you to use machine learning in your everyday projects and learn about the power of TensorFlow. This is a great opportunity for anyone with basic technical knowledge and limited Machine Learning knowledge willing to gain some practical experience in ML and TensorFlow.

Prerequisites & prework:
Please find and prepare yourself with the prerequisites here:
https://developers.google.com/machine-learning/crash-course/prereqs-and-prework

Agenda
17:00 kick off
17:15 Overview & first 3 modules of MLCC
19:00 Dinner Break
19:15 Tensor Flow modules
21:00 Wrap up

Place: CoWorx, Kristiansand

events.name: Tensorflow Summit 2019 - Live
events.description:
Are you interested in Machine Learning?
Is TensorFlow relevant for you?

TensorFlow Dev Summit brings together a diverse mix of machine learning users from around the world for two days of highly technical talks, demos, and conversation with the TensorFlow team and community.

Together with BETA student organization we are arranging a live streaming together with food and a good environment at BlueBox, Grimstad.
A great opportunity to meet and talk to others working on Machine Learning in Agder in a relaxed environment.

At this meetup we will also like to discuss interests and activities for 2019.

While attending is free, we need your cooperation to plan the food.

events.name: Google Cloud Study Jam
events.description:
Heard about Google Cloud, but don't know how to start?
Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!
It will be a great introduction to Google Cloud features.
Together, GDG Sørlandet and Digin are bringing Google Cloud Study Jam to Kristiansand!

• What we'll do
Together we'll work through 3 Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs on Qwiklabs (official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge) .

After the Study Jam, you’ll receive 30-days free access to the entire Qwiklabs catalogue, so you can keep developing your skills at home.
Complete all of the labs in the session’s quest, and you’ll earn an additional free month of access to Qwiklabs as well as a badge for your online profile.

• What to bring
Bring a laptop and charger.
For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

Agenda:

17:00 : Setup QwikLabs

17:10 : Three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs:

* A Tour of Qwiklabs and the Google Cloud Platform

* Creating a Virtual Machine

* Getting Started with Cloud Shell & gcloud

18:40 : Break.

19:00 : Deploying a Python Flask Web Application to App Engine Flexible

20:00 : End

group_profile.intro: Business owner, programmer, Linux administrator and more.
